definitions: To renovate and improve (a house or district) so that it conforms to middle-class taste.
To change the character of a poor urban area through the influx of more affluent residents and businesses, often displacing poorer residents.
examples: Developers plan to gentrify the old warehouse district.
The new coffee shops and boutiques are starting to gentrify the neighborhood.
Efforts to gentrify the area have led to rising rents.
